Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh my God! I can't believe it! I jut won an art contest! [Erin screams, Pam and Jim look at each other, Dwight, laughing, gets up and hands her some money]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [whispering] Thanks. I still don't understand why you wanted me to say that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Shut up.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [laughs hysterically] I got her!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Not cool, Dwight. [Dwight continues laughing]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Not cool. [Dwight still laughing]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [caught by camera crew dancing to "At the Car Wash", but laughing] Oh, no. I still have the lease on the Michael Scott Paper Company, so occasionally I will sneak down here for a little coffee and dancing. I actually dance all the time. Tip-toeing around corporate - it is a ballet. When I am breaking all the rules, I am break dancing. And expresso.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Guys, I'm scared. I'm really scared. I think I'm growing into a giant. Because look at this normal sized coffee cup. Looks so tiny in my giant hand now. Anybody want to go to lunch with me later on?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I do.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. How about a woman? Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, I can't do lunch. I was just sending you an email. Jim and I need to leave early today to meet with our contractor.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, really? Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Just sent it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What about the rest of you? [complete silence]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: At Dunder-Mifflin there is a very strict no lunch with the boss policy and I don't know who instituted it. I think it started right after my predecessor stepped down, but at the Michael Scott Paper Company I really enjoyed having lunch with Pam and Ryan everyday. So, rules be damned, I wanna have lunch with these people.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who else? Who else? Ryan?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I don't do lunch. I'm eating five small meals a day now.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Now that I'm back to doing the job of a temp, again, I find that food is one thing I can control.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok. Anyone? Anyone? At all? Accounting? I am accounting on you to go to lunch with me.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No. I don't want to stay late to have a two hour lunch.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Michael, we have a lot of work to do.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Work.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ugh! God! What happened to you people? [talking like a robot] We are just office drones. We are office drones. All we do is work... is work.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: If you don't take out his battery, he just keeps going all day.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, no. Your battery fell out.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [still talking like a robot] I... was just learning... to... love.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hi, guys. How you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Erin, how many times do I have to tell you? It is not necessary for you to ask us how we are doing every time you interact with us.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Right. I'm sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [sighs] Now, how can I help you?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Did somebody here leave a map in the printer to Youngstown, Ohio?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Attention, office. Who here is planning a trip to Youngstown, Ohio? I will take your silence to mean that you are all hiding something. This location is the Superior Court -

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So someone is going to a court. Big deal.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It is a big deal. Cause there's only a handful of reasons why someone would ever go to a courthouse in Ohio and not be charged with a crime. To claim an inheritance from a deceased relative. To obtain a learner's permit at age 14 and a half instead of 15. Erin, let me see your birth certificate.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: There are other reasons to go to Ohio.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We're getting married today.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So, it turns out it's the closest place to get a marriage license without a 3 day waiting period.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Tell 'em how it happened.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok. So, we're going through all the wedding plans and, boy, it is complicated.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And very expensive.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Very expensive. Cause you say you want a small wedding and that's great but then you have to invite -

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You can't leave anyone out.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No one.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ok, just get to the good part.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok. Right. Oh, so this morning we are having breakfast together and I just looked up from my cereal and I said, " You know what I want to do today? I want to marry you."

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I had just woken up. I didn't look cute. That's how I knew he meant it.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Michael? Michael sorry to bother you. Are you going to be working down here? Do you want these down here now?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No work. No work. No work. I come in here to release frustration. Ooh. Ah. Ah. Ah. Ooh.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Well, I like to swim.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's good.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: You have a cool place to come hang.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: If you ever want to come down here, door's always open, lock's broken, so...

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Come on in. Hey, hey, hey. Here we go. Here we go. Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Now you got it.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Now I do got it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Now you got it. Hey, you want some espresso?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You gotta keep yourself dehydrated.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: That's rule #1.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok. I love it. I love it.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Whew.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I love it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Guys, I believe that I have figured out what is up your butts. There's no reason to be scared. The bad man is gone.Charles is gone.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Charles really did a number on these guys. They are way too focused on work. When I was in charge, this place was like Dave and Buster's People just hanging out, having, fun, eating apps. I don't know. It's like [pause] Dave died or something.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Daddy's here and daddy is going to take care of you.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Please don't refer to yourself as our daddy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am your big daddy and I am gonna kiss da boo boo.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [baby voice] Wittle Andy is afwaid.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Andy's afwaid?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Are you all afwaid?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Daddy's here for you. My wittle angels. Ok. I think that I have figured a way to get you guys out of your funk.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Funk is the problem and the solution.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That makes sense.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I've taken my downstairs office and I have turned it into a place to hang out. A place where unattractive and attractive people can get together. To meet. To greet. To see the ones that you love. To love the ones that you see.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Is this our punishment for not wanting to have lunch with you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why don't you get over lunch, Oscar? Everybody else is past it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Jack Nicholson impression] All work and no play makes Michael a dull boy.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: This is like a haunted coffeehouse thing?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. Dwight is confusing you. That - it's, it's more of a disco.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It's like a haunted disco.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ... with coffee but without the haunted.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: It's a combo dance house coffee bar.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's a daytime disco on the ground floor of and industrial office building.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: It's a cafe disco.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Exactly.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: So, like, a disco cafe?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wha - No. No. Not even close. I can't force you to go down but I can entice you. I'm gonna be down there. Erin will be down there from time to time... and all-you-can-eat espresso.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, Kevin, I guess it is just me and you.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Holdin' down the fort.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah. This place is great.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh, my God, Kevin. I am still on hold. You were supposed to get the answer from Michael and come back up.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I'm sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is a no work zone. Please respect the lei.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah. Respect the lei.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Come.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Kevin, stay.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Kevin, come.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Kevin, stay.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Kevin, come.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stay, stay.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Come on, right now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Cookie. Kevin, cookie.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Ugh. There is no cookie, Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [to Michael] Is there a cookie?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Wha -

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh, for goodness sakes, Kevin. There's no cookie. There's no cookie. Come on. Come.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I wanted a cookie.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Completely unacceptable.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Now I know what the founders of Phillip-Morris felt like. you just want to give people a smooth, fun way to relax and suddenly you're just some terrible monster.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [Michael is holding the stereo speaker up to a vent - blaring "[Gonna Make You Sweat] Everybody Dance Now", spins in chair] Oww!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Aw, what the hell? [goes to Vance Refrigeration] Hi, Jessica. Is Bob in?

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: Oh, he's on a call.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh, I'll just duck my head in.

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: It's pretty important. He wouldn't want to be disturbed. Can I give him a message before he gets off?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Tell him I'm going dancing downstairs in the storage closet between the bathrooms that used to be a utility shower and he should join me there.

Quote.Speaker: Jessica
Quote.Text: I'll let him know.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Mmm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Phyllis?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Hey. I like.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [starts dancing with Phyllis] Alright. Back. There you are. There you go. Good. Good. Ooh. Show me some attitude.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh! Mother ******!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, God! No! No! No! No! No!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Back!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, wow! What did you do?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [moans in pain]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You didn't do that. You're ok. You're ok. Let's lie down. You want to go down? Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Wow! Sorry!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok. That's ok. That's not a problem. Ok, sweetie.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey! Hey, hey, hey! I got your text. Who's Phillip?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. No. No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Who tipped you over? Was it Phillip?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: It's my back.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's her back. We just - We need - Let's - You know what?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Call a doctor.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We're going to take care of you. We're gonna get you help. Let's - come on.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: No. Call Bob.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, no. No. No. This is no good.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah. Back injuries are common. Not as common as knee injuries but more common than wrist injuries.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't need you to give me a history lesson. Ok?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What do you think history is?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's just, we need to get her out of here because no one is going to want to go in there with a woman writhing around on the floor. Wait, wait, wait. But most importantly we need to get her some medical attention. ASAP. Stat.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [barging through office door] Alright. Here we go.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Out of the way! Move it or lose it!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You having fun?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, my God! What happened?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What? Oh, just having to much fun. Phyllis, we're going to put you in here. Dwight's going to take care of you.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: What? No. I thought we were going to the hospital.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You want to get sick you go to the hospital.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, Dwight. Ok. Good. I do not want anyone to worry.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What happened to Phyllis?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, you know. Nohting. She's - we were hanging out at Cafe Disco and she had a flare up of am existing injury. But she's a tough, old bird. So...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Can you please go back to work instead of masterminding these situations were in we hurt ourselves?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok. Phyllis did injure herself. But she injured herself having fun and I don't think she would trade that memory for anything. [Phyllis can be heard screaming in the backgroud]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I would like the memory of a day uninterrupted by this nonsense.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You all took a life here today. you did. The life of the party. Erin?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I want you to go downstairs and I want you to shut it down.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Like unplug the coffee machine and bring it up here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't care. Bury it. I hope you're happy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [exits the conference room in an undershirt] I'm gonna need two able bodied men.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Cafe Disco? More like Crappe Disco.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: You're bad. [they turn off the lights and turn on music - start dancing]

Quote.Speaker: Vance Refrigeration Guy 1
Quote.Text: There's girl in there.

Quote.Speaker: Vance Refrigeration Guy 2
Quote.Text: Where?

Quote.Speaker: VRG 1
Quote.Text: The other room?

Quote.Speaker: VRG 2
Quote.Text: What other room?

Quote.Speaker: VRG 1
Quote.Text: Down the hall.

Quote.Speaker: VRG 2
Quote.Text: There's girls in there?

Quote.Speaker: VRG 1
Quote.Text: What'd I just say?

Quote.Speaker: VRG 2
Quote.Text: You have another sandwich?

Quote.Speaker: VRG 1
Quote.Text: Forget the sandwich. Girls. Girls.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I guess they got what they want. I am eating alone. Might as well be dinner.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You comfy? Alright? Alright. Relax. Relax, ok?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Dwight! Dwight!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Come on. Relax. The shirt wasn't doing you any favors. If my assessment in correct, you grind your teeth?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I do.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No kidding! She sits three feet from me. It's the most annoying thing. [mimics grinding teeth] It's like children singing Christmas carols.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah! I love the vibe down here.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Ashley! You made it!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You invited someone?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah. Was I not allowed to do that?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I've been here 8 years and I've never... [Erin walks away] Rude.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm not sure, but I'm pretty sure I'm in a dance off. Alright!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Cafe Disco is dead but I can still hear the music in my head.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I hear it, too, Boss.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's better than I imagined it!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: That feels good, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Tell me where it hurts.

Quote.Speaker: Phylis
Quote.Text: Right... mmmm... right there.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh yeah. you've got a knot in your crest. This remedy has been passed down in my family for generations. and it always works. My grandfather was told that Diamond Dancer would never race again. they were wrong. He came in 9th in the Apple Creek Derby and his jerky came in 3rd the following year. A majestic beast. So fast. So tender.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Welcome, welcome! Cafe Disco. I am Michael Scott.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hey, Angela! Welcome to -

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Stop!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Angela. Angela. Angela. May I interest you in a triple espresso or perhaps a dance?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No. I didn't come down here to get wet and wild. I just need you to sign these.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh. Alright. There you go.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No. You need to sign them all.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. No. No. Here is the deal - one signature for every song.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Look, I hate to be "that" person but I just don't like the general spirit of music.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know. I know, Angela. A lot of people doubted Cafe Disco at first but it is a magical place. You have to give it a chance. If these walls could tale they would say, " This is a magical place! You are safe here. We have talking walls. We're not going to eat you." [Angela shows Michael the papers again] No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is oil from the gland of an otter. It keeps their fur water resistant, as well as traps heat. Now I need you to lie still for an hour.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: An hour? I can't stay here an hour.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Whoa! Whoa, whoa, girl. Whoa. Whoa.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Boss, this used to hang from my windshield but it belongs in here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, thank you, Creed. you're really getting this place.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: No problem. I'll just have no idea who's driving behind me now.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm gonna with the python.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: But the rattler's so scary.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No. Please. I find the rattle soothing. It puts me to sleep.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I think Bob is gonna cheat on me with his new secretary. [she starts to giggle]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What's so funny?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: When I say it out loud it's so silly. [they both laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey! Hey! Angela, no! No cleaning up!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You are forcing me to be down here. Am I not allowed to have some fun?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No... cleaning... up.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [waiting outside the bathroom for Pam, he is holding a hand-picked bouquet of flowers and pacing] These are for you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: They're beautiful.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You ready?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We should probably stop by. It'd mean a lot to him.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey! Hey! Jim and Pam! Can you believe this? It's really happening.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Wanna dance, Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ordinarily I would say no but you need to move to reduce lactic acid build-up. Also, this song is fantastic.

Quote.Speaker: Bob Vance
Quote.Text: Mind if I steal my wife?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You can't steal what is legally your property.

Quote.Speaker: Bob Vance
Quote.Text: Are those staples?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: This dance competition is not over.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: What dance competition? I was just dancin' casual with my friends, y'all.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You guys are the best for coming. You don't have to stay if you don't want to. I understand.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We're gonna stay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. At least for one more dance.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, no. Not me. Not me. Get out of here. Cafe Disco! [Dwight hits Michael in ear] Hey! Come on, man. It's not even to "Y".

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: This is so cheesy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I like cheesy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Me, too.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah. I think maybe I want a "wedding" wedding.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Me, too.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Would you like to dance?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No. [Camera pans to down to show her swinging her foot to the music]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah. No. Well, ok.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Stop squirming.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, stop trying to poke me with a sharp thing.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: You wanted to do this. Just be brave.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I, I - but you're not a professional and I'm thinking maybe we should have gone to a professional.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I'm doing it. No. I'm doing it for free. You have to stop squirming otherwise I'm gonna mess up.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Are you sure that's not the "gay" ear?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Gay ear? Are you 12 years old?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, I...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Look, I'm gonna count to 3.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Count to twen - count to twenty.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: No. I'm gonna count to 3.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [mumble]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Agh! Son of a bitch!

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Andy, that was just the ice.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It was?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yeah. It was.

Quote.Speaker: Lynn
Quote.Text: Hey, Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hi. Did you have bacon for breakfast?

Quote.Speaker: Lynn
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh...cause you smell like bacon.

Quote.Speaker: Lynn
Quote.Text: I didn't think I did. How's everything going?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Tight. I'm going down the hall to this office to see Michael - there's free espressos.

Quote.Speaker: Lynn
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I would invite you but I remember that you just want to be friends.

Quote.Speaker: Lynn
Quote.Text: We can still...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Are you sure that you didn't eat bacon?

Quote.Speaker: Lynn
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh. Whatever it is I like it. Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Lynn
Quote.Text: Yes, I had some bacon this morning. I just didn't think it was anyone's business.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I love the smell of bacon on a woman.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hey, Lynn, it's Kevin. I was thinking about going and getting a coffee at the Cafe Disco, wondering if you want to go with. Bye. Angela, my stomach is really hurting.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Just go down, Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: My grandpa was the funnest guy I ever knew. He would sing. He would dance. He would....fall down. But then...he started going to these meetings and everything changed. He...stopped going out at night. He got a job. The fun just dried up. It was really sad. I don't want that to happen to you guys. I'm not gonna let it happen.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: How did I end up back in Crazytown?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It is hard to imagine you playing softball.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I was all-county my junior and senior years.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh yeah? Big deal. I once hit three home runs against Little Flower Catholic.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: The girls school?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I played high school softball. Notice I didn't say "girls" high school softball. Not after the landmark case of Shrute vs. the Lackawanna County Board of Education.That was one case the Pennsylvania Supreme Court got right. I hit the ball right over the protest banners.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [sarcastically] Oh, no. I love Ohio. Next time you're there say "Hi" to my cousin Amel and then kick him in the groin area because he's a cheat and a ball hog. And if he's still married to Clarissa, kick her in the groin area, too. 'Cause she's a heart breaking tart...and a ball hog.
